text: This is a list with brief descriptions of Topps sports card products for 1977. ==Baseball== {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |660 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Cloth Stickers | |73 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ===Parallel Sets=== ====United States==== In 1977 Topps produced a set featuring the New York Yankees for New York City area Burger King fast food restaurants. The cards were identical to the 1977 Topps regular issue cards and were distributed as part of a promotion at the company's outlets in the region. Some of the players had a different photo than their Topps counterpart. This Burger King set originally had 22 cards plus a checklist card, but a Lou Piniella card was added after the promotion began along with a revised checklist. Only the checklist card featured any Burger King branding. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text- align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Burger King Yankees | |24 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |} ====Canada==== Since 1965, the Canadian candy company O-Pee-Chee produced virtually identical, but smaller, sets identical to the Topps issue of the same year. The Canadian printed cards were printed on grey cardstock and featured French and English text on the reverse. In 1977 different photos were used on some of the cards and some included traded lines. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |O-Pee-Chee | |264 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ==Football== In 1977, Topps issued three Football sets featuring the National Football League. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |528 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Team Checklists | |30 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Holsun Packers/Vikings | |22 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ===Parallel Sets=== In 1977, Topps issued a Football set featuring the National Football League in Mexico. ====Mexico==== {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Topps Mexican | |528 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ==Hockey== Topps issued two sets featuring the National Hockey League for the 1977-1978 season. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |264 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Glossy Insert | |22 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ==Basketball== Topps issued one set featuring the National Basketball Association for the 1977-1978 season. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |Base set | |132 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ==Soccer== In 1977, Topps issued two sets in the United Kingdom featuring soccer players. The cards fronts are basically identical to the 1976 Topps baseball cards issued in the United States. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Set !Description !Cards in Set !Size |- |English Footballers |Red and black back |330 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |Scottish Footballers |Yellow and black back |132 |2.5 x 3.5 inches |- |} ==References== * Beckett, Dr. James et al.
